decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Site Location Plan, Site Block Plan, Existing Ground Floor Plan rev P1, Existing Roof Plan rev P1, Existing Front and Rear Elevation rev P1, Existing Side Elevation rev P1, Existing Section rev P1, Proposed Ground Floor Plan rev P1, Proposed Roof Plan rev P1, Proposed Front and Rear Elevation rev P1, Proposed Side Elevation rev P1, Proposed Section rev P1, Design & Access Statement dated March 2023.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the proposed café/showroom shall only be used under Class E (a)(b) and not for any other use without permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard the employment land in accordance with 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies D3, D14, E8 of the London Plan, policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The use of the café/showroom premises shall not be permitted outside of the hours of 0600-2000 hours    Monday to Sunday (including Bank Holidays) and all customers shall vacate the premises within 20 minutes of service ceasing.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 Noise and Vibration and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - sections 2 and 12, London Plan Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Policy 7.15.
| No cooking or preparation of hot food shall be carried out at any time for the showroom/cafe hereby permitted on the ground floor.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by emissions from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 Noise and Vibration and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - sections 2 and 12, London Plan Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Policy 7.15  .

| 2 long-stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development. The long-stay cycle parking spaces shall be within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with all adopted standards prior to the first use of the extension hereby approved. The cycle spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy Ealing's sustainable transport SPD and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use of Mini Cab Offices (Use Class Sui Generis) to a Café/Showroom (commercial unit) (Use Class E(a)(b)); alterations to front shopfront involving installation of new shop front, replacement of front door with double glazed door, installation of new tiles to front entrance; single storey side/rear extension (following demolition of existing side/ rear addition); single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing rear addition); installation of rear garden patio, new glazing; installation of cycle storage; bin storage to rear

open_spaces_details.description: New side return and rear extension will result in loss of rear garden area.
